results.title: It needs political decisions
results.creator_credit: Vivian Ducat, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines the role that governments can play in protecting the environment. In Zimbabwe, President Mugabe talks about the importance of education and of balancing people’s needs against those of the environment. In Thailand, as in Zimbabwe, population growth has been a major problem, and government birth control programs have played an important role in reducing this growth. Popular protest also plays a role in influencing governments, as in Sweden which now has a nuclear ban forced by the people, but care should also be taken that the political decisions made have taken every possible outcome into consideration. Narrated by Karina Kelly. A teacher’s book accompanies the video.

results.title: It need not happen
results.brief_description: A report on the statistics of road accidents and the measures that are being taken to improve the safety of the roads. The film maintains that, by exercising care in the use of the roads, the public can co-operate in making them safe.

results.title: It might be you
results.brief_description: A number of people leave their respective homes by car, bicycle and on foot; they all just manage to avoid accidents until they all arrive at the same stretch of road and collide. Some of the people in the film escape unharmed - others don’t. This is a road safety film with a difference. Features Peter Cushing.

results.title: It is called New Zealand
results.brief_description: Proving that a country needn’t be stuffy when showing itself off. This film is a total impression of the nation - a montage of picture and sound that needs no spoken commentary.

results.title: It is always so in the world
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Bob Kingsbury and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of China”.
Shanghai in 1979, with its 11 million people, and the second biggest city in the world, was for years dominated by foreign powers. Following the end of the revolution in the early 1970s, China is now caught up in the urgency to accelerate progress and this is expressed by a massive campaign to make everyone personally committed to the aim of the 4 modernisations: to catch up with the west in science, education, agriculture and defence by the year 2000.

results.title: It happened here again
results.brief_description: A look at the making of “Winstanley”, a low budget feature film by independent filmmakers Kevin Brownlow and Arthur Mollo. Shows the search for actors, locations and money for this adaptation of a period from 17th century British history, concerned with the setting up of a commune by Winstanley, a man with a socialist vision. As well, Brownlow and Mollo talk of their beginnings in the film industry and their other film ventures. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: It feels like you're left out of the world: experiencing learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Robert Anderson Associates and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Learning Series”.
Children speak of their attitudes towards their own learning disabilities, and of the way in which their life has been affected by these disabilities. Articulates the personal and social consequences of having a learning problem - the feeling of being a failure is a classroom lesson that many of these children never forget. Shows that the children given time and special help, their problems can be overcome.

results.title: It doesn't hurt to know
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions and Ted Robinson
results.brief_description: Discusses the symptoms, causes and prevention of P.I.D. - Pelvic Inflammatory Disease, a sexually transmitted infection causing infertility in young women. Stresses the importance of check-ups, the use of condoms and honest communication between partners.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions and Ted Robinson

results.title: It didn't have to happen
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the careless worker who scorns safety devices on modern machinery endangers not only his own life but the lives of fellow workers. It portrays a careless employee and the tragic result of his slipshod methods. Designed to show employers in industry why guards are put on machines and how they should be used.
